text: Can, pours a hazy golden with large white head. Aroma is honey, malt, bread, soap, and fruit. Flavor is chalk, fruit, spice, and ashy grain. Lots of carbonation on a light body. Not a fan

Can 330ml. @ [ (PBF XI) by oh6gdx - Petalax ]. [ As Chorlton Olicana Lager ].Unclear medium orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, sweet malt, moderate hoppy, citrus, grass, pineapple. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration, sweet malt, fruity hops, pale malt. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160709]
 6-3-6-3-13

Can at home, 05/02/17.
Hazed orange golden with a well presented off white head.
Nose is orange peel, melon, straw, fresh grass, light spice, juicy hop slash.
Taste comprises tangerine, floral notes, straw, bread dough, pale malts, light pissy citricana, ripe melon, lemon sherbets.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a juicy hop tang.
Solid hopped lager, could crush a lot of this, nice pissy dank edge to it.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Can (best before date - 30th May 2017). Hazy golden body with a thin white head. Low carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of green apple, celery and orange sherbet. Flavour of mint, blood orange and lime. Medium body with a smooth, frothy texture. Soft fizz. Theres a nice Orval-esque vibe to this. My favourite Chorlton beer to date.
Can from ales by mail. Appearance is gold orange. Light hazy. Thin white head. Medium body and carbonation. Hops, vegetables, dms, fresh leaves.
Can at jamess. Pours hazy orange, nose is citrus, toffee, taste is juicy citrus, dry, bitter.

Yellow colour, creamy mediumsized thick white head. Aroma is nectar, honey, wood and some herbs. Flavour is nectar, toffee and some slight wooden and herbal notes.
Can from Alesbymail. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 010816

June 2016 - Can share at Scopeys as Chorlton Olicana Lager. Many thanks to Ken. Hazy orange, opaque, lightly sparkling, foamy white head. Aroma, like the others, is dominated by celery. Also has some salty, piney notes, papery, passionfruit. Body is light, tingly carbonation, foamy. Taste is chalky, floral, celery, card, tonic water, a little papery. Decent. (3.3)
can at home .. hazy amber ... thin white lacing ... soft funky citrus fruit nose ... sweet thick ... herbal fruit .. off fruit .. wierd
Can shared with Stuu666. Pours hazy gold with a thin white head. Aromas of grassy hops and orange. Taste is bitter, more orange. Clean finish.

33cl can via BeEr Gonzo. It pours a hazed golden color with s medium white head. Aroma is clean tangerine and citric notes alongside grass and grains. Very clean and crispy. Taste is also quite dry and crispy with notes notes of lemon peel, grass, tangerine and melon. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice

33cl can @ PBF XI. 
Poured golden color with a thin white head. 
Aroma has perfumy Belgian hoppy. 
Grainy malty, perfumy, floral. Quite ok.

330ml can @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours hazy gold, good white head. Aroma is fresh, light citric fruit. Taste is citrus, mild lime and tangerine, soft malts, fair carbonation. Prefer the Mosaic lager, but this is nice too.

Can (from beer gonzo). Pours golden. Aroma is hoppy, fruity, tangerines, pears, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, hoppy, citrus, tangerines, grapefruit. Finish is dry bitter orange with lingering sweetness. Overall: good.

Can shared by Mart, thanks! Hazy golden amber beer, white head. Nose is spicy, floral, hoppy, fruity. Flavor is sweet, spicy, dry, tangerines. Finishes juicy and dry at the same time, sound weird, but somehow works out, lots of hops, pineapple notes, tangerines. Lingering hoppy dryness. Very drinkable, does not come off lagery at all.

Grain and bread malts, light citrus pith and rind. Hazy, pale gold, massive, frothy, white head. Light sweet. Grain malts, light sweet bread, citrus fruits, tangerine, light tropical fruits, mango, lively carbonation, bitter and dry finish. Can from HopLocker, Southbank.

Can. Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. Very hazy gold. Thin, messy, just off white head. Nose has sweet, yeasty, bready, damp and fusty malts. Spicy, floral hop. Some stone fruit. Some earthy notes. Bit of melon. Quite unusual. Taste is light, bready sweet. Earthy bitterness. Plenty of body. Slightly oily mouthfeel, tempered by brisk carbonation. Earthy finish, that gets fruitier as it goes along.

16th June 2016Scopeys grand vertical. Can. Hazy gold beer, good cream colour head. Palate is airy, semi dry and has decent fine carbonation. Fluffy malts, mildly sweet. Hops bring a mildly spicy floralness. Modest pineapple and a touch of citrus. Light dry finish. Mellow spicy linger. Good.

Bottle shared at Scopey place birthday tasting. Big thanks to Kenny for this one. A hazed yellow straw coloured pour with a lasting thin white head. Aroma is grassy citrus hop, straw, plastic, . Flavour is composed of of light grains, spicy citrus rind. Pineapple, papaya. Palate is semi crisp, highish carbonation. Decent.

Can in Croydon. Big thanks to Kenny. It pours murky / cloudy dirty blonde with a thick off-white head. The aroma is fresh, juicy, sweet pineapple, passion fruit, mango, bready, straw and light spice. The taste is smooth, mellow bitterness, grassy, pineapple, passion fruit, fruit salad sweets, light alcohol, straw, white bread and grass with a dry finish. Medium body and fine, foamy carbonation. Very tasty and drinkable. My favourite of the series so far.

Can shared in East Croydon - thanks to Kenny. Pours unclear gold with a creamy topping. Nice aroma, fresh citrus fruits, peach. Light sweet flavor with lightly dried pale bread, some hay, citrus rind, more peach, melon, tangerine. Light bodied with average carbonation. Fairly clean on the finish, with further peach, nectarine, citrus, light rindy bitterness. Solid.
